definition: in the wrong
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
to know that one is in the wrong (idiom)

sentences.english: That person is certainly in the wrong. is druggist right to do so?
sentences.chinese: 那个人当然是理亏的，那么药店老板做得对吗？

sentences.english: I knew I wrong, and had confessed.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我理亏了，只好承认了。

sentences.english: Modern man station indefensible, lie sexual debility.
sentences.chinese: 现代男人站着理亏，躺着肾亏。

sentences.english: Boy consciously indefensible, red-faced climbed down from the tree.
sentences.chinese: 男孩自觉理亏，就红着脸爬下了树。

sentences.english: Later, they consciously wrong, changed his attitude.
sentences.chinese: 后来他们自觉理亏，改变了态度。

sentences.english: A good wife always forgives her husband when she is wrong.
sentences.chinese: 好老婆自己理亏时总会原谅老公的。

sentences.english: It also does not prove themselves wrong plant it?
sentences.chinese: 这还不能证明加工厂自己理亏吗？

sentences.english: The man from knew oneself bed in the wrong, has kept off the road, was only saying any anxiously.
sentences.chinese: 男人自知道自己理亏，挡了路，只说着什么急。

sentences.english: She was humble, and wishing to be forgiven;
sentences.chinese: 她自知理亏，希望家里原谅。

definition: to know that one is in the wrong (idiom)
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
to keep the peace; to patch up a quarrel (idiom)
to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to retort/to answer back
to be put on the spot/to find oneself in an awkward situation
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
to lose face
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
